##### 6.3.1.1.1.4 Test description {#test-description-38 .H6}

##### 6.3.1.1.1.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-37 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid-Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.11
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.1.1.1.3\_1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* according to
TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined in
clause6.3.1.1.1.4.3.

##### 6.3.1.1.1.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-38 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.1.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format 1\_1 for C\_RNTI to
transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI report from
the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS
schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs
allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry the PUSCH
CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1 with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI feedback.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-5 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1
with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.1.1.1.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is failed.

##### 6.3.1.1.1.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-38 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.1.2.1.4 Test description {#test-description-39 .H6}

##### 6.3.1.2.1.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-38 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid-Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.11
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.1.2.1.3\_1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* according to
TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined in
clause6.3.1.2.1.4.3.

##### 6.3.1.2.1.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-39 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.1.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format 1\_1 for C\_RNTI to
transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI report from
the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS
schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs
allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry the PUSCH
CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1 with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI feedback.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-5 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1
with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.1.2.1.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is failed.

##### 6.3.1.2.1.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-39 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

### 6.3.2 2RX requirements

#### 6.3.2.1 FDD

##### 6.3.2.1.1 2Rx FDD FR1 Single PMI with 4TX TypeI-SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.1.1.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-40 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.1.1.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-40 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

downlink physical channels specified in Annex C.3.1, the minimum
requirements are specified in Table 6.3.2.1.1-2.

##### 6.3.2.1.1.4 Test description {#test-description-40 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.1.1.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-39 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.1.3\_1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause6.3.2.1.1.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.1.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-40 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.1.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-5 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.1.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.1.1.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-40 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.1.2.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-41 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.2.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or

according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.2.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.2.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-42 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.1.2.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.2.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

supporting EN-DC.

##### 6.3.2.1.3.4 Test description {#test-description-43 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.1.3.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-42 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.3.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.3.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.3.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-43 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.1.3.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.3.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.1.3.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-43 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.1.4.4 Test description {#test-description-44 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.1.4.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-43 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.4.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.4.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.4.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-44 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.1.4.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.4.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.1.4.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-44 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.1.5 2Rx FDD FR1 Multiple PMI with 16Tx TypeII codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.1.5.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-45 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.1.5.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-45 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward
supporting Type II codebook.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC and Type II codebook.

##### 6.3.2.1.5.4 Test description {#test-description-45 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.1.5.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-44 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.5.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.4.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.5.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-45 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.1.5.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities, and the
random precoder generation shall follow the codebook configuration as
specified in Table 6.3.2.1.5.3-1. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits
on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI
feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.5.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.1.5.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-45 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.1.6 2Rx FDD FR1 Multiple PMI with 16Tx Enhanced TypeII codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.1.6.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-46 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.1.6.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-46 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 16 and forward
supporting Enhanced Type II codebook with at least 16 ports per CSI-RS
resource.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 16 and forward
supporting EN-DC and Enhanced Type II codebook with at least 16 ports
per CSI-RS resource.

downlink physical channels specified in Annex C.3.1, the minimum
requirements are specified in Table 6.3.2.1.6.3-2.

##### 6.3.2.1.6.4 Test description {#test-description-46 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.1.6.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-45 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.6.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.6.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.6.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-46 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.1.6.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format 1\_1 for C\_RNTI to
transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI report from
the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS
schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs
allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry the PUSCH
CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1 with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI feedback.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1
with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.6.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.1.6.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-46 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 5.4.2.

##### 6.3.2.1.7 2Rx FDD FR1 Single PMI with 8TX TypeI-SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.1.7.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-47 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.1.7.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-47 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 17 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 17 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

downlink physical channels specified in Annex C.3.1, the minimum
requirements are specified in Table 6.3.2.1.7.3-2.

##### 6.3.2.1.7.4 Test description {#test-description-47 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.1.7.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-46 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.7.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.7.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.7.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-47 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.1.7.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format 1\_1 for C\_RNTI to
transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI report from
the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS
schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs
allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry the PUSCH
CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI feedback.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.7.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.1.7.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-47 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clauses 4.6.1 and
5.4.

##### 6.3.2.1.7.5 Test requirement {#test-requirement-25 .H6}

Table 6.3.2.1.7.5-1: Test requirement

  **Parameter**   **Test 1**
  --------------- ------------
  *γ*             1.59

##### 6.3.2.1.8 

##### 6.3.2.1.9 2Rx FDD FR1 Multiple PMI with 8 ports Enhanced Type II Codebook for CJT for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.1.9.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-48 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.1.9.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-48 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 18 and forward
supporting ***eType-II codebook with refinement for multi-TRP CJT***.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 18 and forward
supporting EN-DC and ***eType-II codebook with refinement for multi-TRP
CJT***.

6.3.2.1.9.

##### 6.3.2.1.9.4 Test description {#test-description-48 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.1.9.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-47 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in section A.3.1.7 for
TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.1.9.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.9.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.1.9.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-48 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.1.9.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format 1\_1 for C\_RNTI to
transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI report from
the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS
schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs
allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry the PUSCH
CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1 with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI feedback.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1
with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in Table
6.3.2.1.9.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is failed.

##### 6.3.2.1.9.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-48 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6 and 5.4.

#### 6.3.2.2 TDD

##### 6.3.2.2.1 2Rx TDD FR1 Single PMI with 4TX TypeI-SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.2.1.1 Test Purpose {#test-purpose-49 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.2.1.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-49 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

downlink physical channels specified in Annex C.3.1, the minimum
requirements are specified in Table 6.3.2.2.1.3-2.

##### 6.3.2.2.1.4 Test Description {#test-description-49 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.2.1.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-48 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of TS
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.2.1.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.2.1.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.2.1.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-49 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.1.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-5 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.2.1.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.2.1.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-49 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.2.2 2Rx TDD FR1 Single PMI with 8TX TypeI-SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.2.2.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-50 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.2.2.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-50 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

downlink physical channels specified in Annex C.3.1, the minimum

##### 6.3.2.2.2.4 Test description {#test-description-50 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.2.2.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-49 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.2.2.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.2.2.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.2.2.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-50 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.2.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.2.2.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.2.2.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-50 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.2.3 2Rx TDD FR1 Multiple PMI with 16Tx Type1 - SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.2.3.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-51 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.2.3.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-51 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

##### 6.3.2.2.4 2Rx TDD FR1 Single PMI with 32Tx Type1 - SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.2.4.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-52 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.2.4.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-52 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

##### 6.3.2.2.4.4 Test description {#test-description-52 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.2.4.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-51 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure
A.3.1.7.10TBD for TE diagram and section A.3.2.3 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.2.4.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.2.4.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.2.4.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-52 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.4.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.2.4.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.2.4.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-52 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.2.5.4 Test description {#test-description-53 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.2.5.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-52 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.2.5.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.4.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.2.5.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-53 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.5.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities, and the
random precoder generation shall follow the codebook configuration as
specified in Table 6.3.2.2.3.3-1. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits
on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI
feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.2.5.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.2.5.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-53 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.2.6 2Rx TDD FR1 Multiple PMI with 16Tx Enhanced TypeII codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.2.2.6.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-54 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.2.6.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-54 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 16 and forward
supporting Enhanced Type II codebook with at least 16 ports per CSI-RS
resource.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 16 and forward
supporting EN-DC and Enhanced Type II codebook with at least 16 ports
per CSI-RS resource.

##### 6.3.2.2.6.4 Test description {#test-description-54 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.2.6.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-53 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.2.6.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.2.6.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.2.6.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-54 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.6.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format 1\_1 for C\_RNTI to
transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI report from
the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS
schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs
allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry the PUSCH
CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1 with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI feedback.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1
with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.2.6.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.2.6.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-54 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 5.4.2.

##### 6.3.2.2.7 2Rx TDD Single PMI with 4TX TypeI-SinglePanel Codebook for RedCap

##### 6.3.2.2.7.1 Test Purpose {#test-purpose-55 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.2.7.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-55 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR RedCap UE with 2Rx from Release 17
onwards.

downlink physical channels specified in Annex C.3.1, the minimum
requirements are specified in Table 6.3.2.2.7.3-2.

##### 6.3.2.2.7.4 Test Description {#test-description-55 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.2.7.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-54 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of TS
38.521-1 \[7\].

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.8
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.3 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.2.7.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, connected without release *On* according to
TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined in clause
6.3.2.2.7.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.2.7.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-55 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.7.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format 1\_1 for C\_RNTI to
transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI report from
the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS
schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs
allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry the PUSCH
CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format 0\_1 with aperiodic CSI request
triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI feedback.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-5 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.2.7.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.2.7.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-55 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.2.2.8 2Rx TDD FR1 Single PMI with 8 ports TypeI-SinglePanel Codebook for Single-DCI based transmission scheme

##### 6.3.2.2.8.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-56 .H6}

The purpose of this test is to test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix
Indicator (PMI) reporting such that the system throughput is maximized
based on the precoders configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.2.2.8.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-56 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 17 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 17 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

downlink physical channels specified in Annex C.3.1, the minimum
requirements are specified in Table 6.3.2.2.8.3-2.

##### 6.3.2.2.8.4 Test description {#test-description-56 .H6}

##### 6.3.2.2.8.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-55 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.2.2.8.3-1 as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.2.8.4.3.

##### 6.3.2.2.8.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-56 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.8.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.2.8.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.2.2.8.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-56 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clauses 4.6.1 and
5.4.

### 6.3.3 4RX requirements

#### 6.3.3.1 FDD

##### 6.3.3.1.1 4Rx FDD FR1 Single PMI with 4TX TypeI-SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.3.1.1.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-57 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

##### 6.3.3.1.1.4 Test description {#test-description-57 .H6}

##### 6.3.3.1.1.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-56 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.3.1.1\_1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.3.1.1.4.3.

##### 6.3.3.1.1.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-57 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.2.2.1.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-5 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.2.1.1.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.3.1.1.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-57 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.3.1.2 4Rx FDD FR1 Single PMI with 8TX TypeI-SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.3.1.2.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-58 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.3.1.2.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-58 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

##### 6.3.3.1.2.4 Test description {#test-description-58 .H6}

##### 6.3.3.1.2.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-57 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.1
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.3.1.2.3-1and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.3.1.2.4.3.

##### 6.3.3.1.2.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-58 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.3.1.2.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-5 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.3.1.2.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.3.1.2.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-58 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.3.1.3 4Rx FDD FR1 Multiple PMI with 16Tx Type I -- SinglePanel Codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.3.1.3.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-59 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.3.1.3.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-59 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

##### 6.3.3.1.3.4 Test description {#test-description-59 .H6}

##### 6.3.3.1.3.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-58 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.3.1.3.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.3.1.3.4.3.

##### 6.3.3.1.3.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-59 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.3.1.3.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for CP-OFDM QPSK
with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1 \[21\] to carry
the PUSCH CQI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI
request triggered. No transport block is sent in parallel to the CQI
feedback. Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities. The SS sends
downlink MAC padding bits on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL
transmission to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format
\[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered. Measure according to
Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.3.1.3.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.3.1.3.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-59 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.3.1.4 4Rx FDD FR1 Single PMI with 32Tx Type1 - SinglePanel codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.3.1.4.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-60 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.3.1.4.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-60 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC.

##### 6.3.3.1.5.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-61 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.3.1.5.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-61 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 15 and forward
supporting Type II codebook.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 15 and forward
supporting EN-DC and Type II codebook.

##### 6.3.3.1.5.4 Test description {#test-description-61 .H6}

##### 6.3.3.1.5.4.1 Initial conditions {#initial-conditions-60 .H6}

Initial conditions are a set of test configurations the UE needs to be
tested in and the steps for the SS to take with the UE to reach the
correct measurement state.

The initial test configurations consist of environmental conditions,
test frequencies, test channel bandwidths and sub-carrier spacing based
on NR operating bands specified in Table 5.3.5-1 and Table 5.3.6-1 of
38.521-1.

Configurations of PDSCH and PDCCH before measurement are specified in
Annex C.

Test Environment: Normal, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.1.

Frequencies to be tested: Mid Range, as defined in TS 38.508-1 \[6\]
clause 5.2.2.

For EN-DC within FR1 operation, setup the LTE link according to Annex D

1\. Connect the SS, the faders and AWGN noise source to the UE antenna
connectors as shown in TS 38.508-1 \[6\] Annex A, in Figure A.3.1.7.10
for TE diagram and section A.3.2.2 for UE diagram.

2\. The parameter settings for the cell are set up according to Table
6.1.2-1 and Table 6.3.3.1.5.3-1 and as appropriate.

3\. Downlink signals for NR cell are initially set up according to
Annexes C.0, C.1, C.2, C.3.1 and uplink signals according to Annexes
G.0, G.1, G.2, G.3.1 of TS 38.521-1 \[7\].

4\. Propagation conditions are set according to Annex B.0.

5\. Ensure the UE is in state RRC\_CONNECTED with generic procedure
parameters Connectivity NR, Connected without release *On* for SA or
(EN-DC, DC bearer *MCG* and *SCG, Connected without Release On)* for NSA
according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.5. Message content are defined
in clause 6.3.2.1.4.4.3.

##### 6.3.3.1.5.4.2 Test procedure {#test-procedure-61 .H6}

1\. Set the parameters of bandwidth, the propagation condition, antenna
configuration and measurement channel according to Table 6.3.3.1.5.3-1
as appropriate.

2\. The SS shall transmit PDSCH via PDCCH DCI format \[1\_1\] for
C\_RNTI to transmit the DL RMC with precoding matrix according to PMI
report from the UE. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits on the DL
RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission to carry the PUSCH CQI feedback
via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\] with aperiodic CSI request triggered.
Establish and according to Annex G.3.2.

3\. Set SNR to. The SS shall transmit PDSCH with randomly selected
precoding matrix from codebook (Table 5.2.2.2.1-6 in TS 38.214 \[12\])
every slot regardless of PMI reports from the UE. Note that each
precoding matrix shall be selected in equal probabilities, and the
random precoder generation shall follow the codebook configuration as
specified in Table 6.3.3.1.5.3-1. The SS sends downlink MAC padding bits
on the DL RMC. SS schedules the UL transmission with an UL RMC for
CP-OFDM QPSK with 5 RBs allocated according to A.2.2.6 of TS 38.521-1
\[21\] to carry the PUSCH CSI feedback via PDCCH DCI format \[0\_1\]
with aperiodic CSI request triggered. No transport block is sent in
parallel to the CQI feedback. Measure according to Annex G.3.3.

4\. Calculate. If the ratio ≥ *γ *which is specified in table
6.3.3.1.5.5-1, then the test is pass. Otherwise, the test is fail.

##### 6.3.3.1.5.4.3 Message contents {#message-contents-61 .H6}

Message contents are according to TS 38.508-1 \[6\] clause 4.6.1.

##### 6.3.3.1.6 4Rx FDD FR1 Multiple PMI with 16Tx Enhanced TypeII codebook for both SA and NSA

##### 6.3.3.1.6.1 Test purpose {#test-purpose-62 .H6}

To test the accuracy of the Precoding Matrix Indicator (PMI) reporting
such that the system throughput is maximized based on the precoders
configured according to the UE reports.

##### 6.3.3.1.6.2 Test applicability {#test-applicability-62 .H6}

This test applies to all types of NR UE release 16 and forward
supporting Enhanced Type II codebook with at least 16 ports per CSI-RS
resource.

This test also applies to all types of EUTRA UE release 16 and forward
supporting EN-DC and Enhanced Type II codebook with at least 16 ports
per CSI-RS resource.
